net.floodlightcontroller.topology

Class TopologyInstance

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.floodlightcontroller.topology.TopologyInstance

  • public class TopologyInstance
extends java.lang.Object
    A representation of a network topology. Used internally by TopologyManager

      • getPathsFast

        public java.util.List<Path> getPathsFast(org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.DatapathId src,
                                         org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.DatapathId dst,
                                         int k)
        This function returns K number of routes between a source and destination IF THEY EXIST IN THE ROUTECACHE. If the user requests more routes than available, only the routes already stored in memory will be returned. This value can be adjusted in floodlightdefault.properties.
        Parameters:
        src: - DatapathId of the route source.
        dst: - DatapathId of the route destination.
        k: - The number of routes that you want. Must be positive integer.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Routes or null if bad parameters

      • getPathsSlow

        public java.util.List<Path> getPathsSlow(org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.DatapathId src,
                                         org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.DatapathId dst,
                                         int k)
        This function returns K number of paths between a source and destination. It will attempt to retrieve these paths from the pathcache. If the user requests more paths than are stored, Yen's algorithm will be run using the K value passed in.
        Parameters:
        src: - DatapathId of the path source.
        dst: - DatapathId of the path destination.
        k: - The number of path that you want. Must be positive integer.
        Returns:
        list of paths or empty

        public Path getPath(org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.DatapathId srcId,

                    org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.OFPort dstPort)
        Computes end-to-end path including src/dst switch ports in addition to the switches. This chains into getPath(DatapathId, DatapathId) below.
        Parameters:
        srcId -
        srcPort -
        dstId -
        dstPort -
        Returns:
